intro: Coccocypselum croatii, commonly known as the Croatian coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes gourds and melons. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
